str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Martha, sister of Mary and Lazarus of Bethany. Probably of Chaldee origin; Martha, a Christian woman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To meet, go to meet. From hupo and a derivative of anti; to go opposite under, i.e. To encounter, fall in with.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be sitting, sit down, be seated. From kata and the base of hedraios; to sit down.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
